title: Maximum value of a  function from derivative graph

content.question: For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FAC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGMbGbauaacaGGSaaaaa@3AA2@</annotation> </semantics> </math> the derivative of <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGMbaaaa@39E6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, is piecewise linear as shown above. If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ED9@</annotation> </semantics> </math> what is the maximum value of <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGMbaaaa@39E6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> on the interval?
